0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• TOPICAL, apply gel twice daily to affected areas for 4 weeks
  • Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte (Mild to Moderate), Fingernails and toenails: TOPICAL, apply lacquer once daily to affected nails with applicator brush; remove with alchohol every 7 days
  • Seborrheic dermatitis of scalp: (0.77% gel) apply gel TOPICALLY twice daily to affected areas for 4 weeks
  • Seborrheic dermatitis of scalp: (1% shampoo) apply 5 mL TOPICALLY to the wet scalp (up to 10 mL for long hair), lather, leave on for 3 minutes, then rinse; repeat twice per week for 4 weeks with at least 3 days between applications
  • Tinea, Superficial: TOPICAL, gently massage gel into affected area twice daily for 4 weeks

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Use of gel/shampoo not FDA approved in children less than 16 years old
  • Seborrheic dermatitis of scalp: (0.77% gel) 16 y and older, apply gel TOPICALLY twice daily to affected areas for 4 weeks
  • Seborrheic dermatitis of scalp: (1% shampoo) 16 y and older, apply 5 mL TOPICALLY to the wet scalp (up to 10 mL for long hair), lather, leave on for 3 minutes, then rinse; repeat twice per week for 4 weeks with at least 3 days between applications
  • Tinea, Superficial: (16 y and older) TOPICAL, gently massage gel into affected area twice daily for 4 weeks

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte (Mild to Moderate), Fingernails and toenails
  • Seborrheic dermatitis of scalp
  • Tinea, Superficial

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• eye contact should be avoided; rinse eye(s) thoroughly with water if contact occurs
  • sensitivity or irritation has been reported; discontinue use if occurs
  • report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Application site reaction, (shampoo), Erythema, Periungual, Pruritus, Sensation of burning of skin

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Topical: Exact mechanism unknown; fungicidal in vitro against Trichophyton rubrum, T. mentagrophytes, Epidermophyton floccosum (Acrothesium floccosum), Microsporum canis, and Candida albicans (Monilia albicans); may inhibit transport of certain essential substrates into fungal cells; may also interfere with the synthesis of proteins, RNA, and DNA in growing fungal cells; alterations in cell permeability, osmotic fragility, and endogenous respiration are affected only at high concentrations of ciclopirox.

0.title: Absorption
0.mono: Topical: Bioavailability: 1% Solution- 1.3%; 8% Solution- <5%; Cream and Lotion- 0.8 to 1.6%

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • (gel) gently massage into affected area and surrounding skin immediately after cleaning or washing the area
  • (shampoo) wet hair, apply 5-10 mL to scalp; lather and leave on hair and scalp for 3 minutes (a timer may be used)
  • (shampoo) treatment should be repeated twice a week for 4 weeks (minimum 3 days between applications)
  • (nail solution) apply once daily to affected nails (preferably at bedtime) with supplied applicator brush; wait 30 seconds for application to dry; wait 8 hours after application before bathing or showering
  • (nail solution) remove previous coats with alcohol, file loose nail materials, and trim nails every 7 days

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• resolution of symptoms (erythema, scaling, pruritus)
  • increased irritation (erythema, burning, blistering, swelling, oozing or itching) at application site
  • no improvement in or worsening of symptoms

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• This drug may cause erythema, pruritus, or a burning sensation when applied.
  • Instruct patient to report signs/symptoms of increased irritation (erythema, burning, blistering, swelling, oozing, itching) at application site.
  • Tell patients that drug is not for ophthalmic, oral, or intravaginal use. Avoid contact with mucous membranes.
  • Advise patient to avoid use of occlusive dressings.
  • Advise patients treating fingernails or toenails not to use nail polish during treatment.
